State of Michigan
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RICK SNYDER NICK LYON
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 9, 2018
Kimberly Bejcek
Arenac County DHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
RE: License #: CP060200953
Arenac County DHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
Dear Ms. Bejcek:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 5/23/18.
The agency was found to be incompliance with applicable licensing rules, and DHHS
policy. However, due to a violation of one ISEP requirement, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the ISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Sincerely,
James B. Gale, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 296-4814

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules:
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will be
the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting requirements.
The agency for the most part was compliant with this requirement however there
were a few documents that were not uploaded into MiSACWIS. The most common
document not uploaded were quarterly updated medical passports.
3.)Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Analyst Report 4/18/18
The DCWL analyst between the dates of 4/6/18 and 4/17/18 visited three licensed
and three unlicensed homes. The analyst conducted interviews with four licensed and
four unlicensed providers and four foster children. One child too young to be
interviewed was observed. The analyst reported the following findings to be followed
up by this consultant. The follow up process included interviewing assigned case
manager and their supervisor as well as a review of the case files. The findings were
also shared with the administration.
4

“One relative was not aware of the ineligible grant that they may be eligible for.”
Arenac County routinely reviews available resources with unlicensed providers at
the time of placement. The assigned case manager will follow up and discuss
available resources with providers. Evidence of these conversations can be
found in the social work contacts.
“One birth parent reported an incident in which the assigned case manager
discussed case information in front of a child.”
This consultant was advised by the supervisor that the assigned case manager
would discuss required drug screens privately with the mother following parent
child visitations in the office. The case manager reported that the children were
well aware of the mother drug use and often would bring it up during parent child
visitations.
Renewal Inspection 6/20/17
The agency was found in compliance with applicable licensing statutes and rules. A
corrective action plan was not required.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
7/9/18
_______________________________________
James B. Gale Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 25, 2018
